pageContext.claim: “You can't make this up!  David Kris, a highly controversial former DOJ official, was just appointed by the FISA Court to oversee reforms to the FBI’s surveillance procedures. Zero credibility. THE SWAMP!”
pageContext.analysis: Kris served as a top Justice Department official in both the George W. Bush and Barack Obama administrations and is respected by national security experts. Three days after Trump criticized him as having "zero credibility," Kris submitted a legal brief to the FISA court arguing that the FBI's proposed reforms to the warrant application process for cases of secret surveillance "do not go far enough."
